[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m101[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Token[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mHigh[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_kits/webhooks.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m(npm owner|password|htpasswd|auth_?token|secret_?key|private_?key|authorized_keys?|npmrc|\.ssh|usersecrets?|api_?keys|nuget\.config|\.identityservice)[0m
[30;1m66 | [0m[35m    * ``certfile``, ``pkeyfile`` define the server's endpoint certificate;[0m
[30;1m67 | [0m[35m      if not specified, a self-signed certificate and CA will be generated[0m
[30;1m68 | [0m[35m      for both ``addr`` & ``host`` as SANs (but only ``host`` for CommonName).[0m
[30;1m69 | [0m[35m    * ``password`` is either for decrypting the provided ``pkeyfile``,[0m
[30;1m70 | [0m[35m      or for encrypting and decrypting the generated private key.[0m
[30;1m71 | [0m[35m    * ``extra_sans`` are put into the self-signed certificate as SANs (DNS/IP)[0m
[30;1m72 | [0m[35m      in addition to the host & addr (in case some other endpoints exist).[0m

[30;1m68 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m229 | [0m[35m        that have no uid but are still exposed via the K8s API[0m
[30;1m230 | [0m[35m        (highly unlikely to be indexed though).[0m

[30;1m112 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m113 | [0m[35m    For smoother upgrades of operators from V1 to V2, and for safer rollbacks[0m
[30;1m114 | [0m[35m    from V2 to V1, both versions of keys are stored in annotations.[0m
[30;1m115 | [0m[35m    At some point in time, the V1 keys will be read, purged, but not stored,[0m
[30;1m116 | [0m[35m    thus cutting the rollback possibilities to Kopf versions with V1 keys.[0m
[30;1m117 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m    Since the annotations are purged in case of a successful handling cycle,[0m

[30;1m102 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m103 | [0m[35m    def _maybe_number(v):[0m

[30;1m702 | [0m[35m=======================[0m
[30;1m703 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m704 | [0m[35mIt is advised that custom servers/tunnels cleanup the system resources[0m
[30;1m705 | [0m[35mthey allocate at runtime. The easiest way is the ``try-finally`` block --[0m
[30;1m706 | [0m[35mthe cleanup will happen on the garbage collection of the generator object[0m
[30;1m707 | [0m[35m(beware: it can be postponed in some environments, e.g. in PyPy).[0m
[30;1m708 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m358[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m

[30;1m672 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m673 | [0m[35mThe server/tunnel must hold control by running the server or by sleeping.[0m
[30;1m674 | [0m[35mTo sleep forever, use ``await asyncio.Event().wait()``. If the server/tunnel[0m
[30;1m675 | [0m[35mexits unexpectedly, this causes the whole operator to exit.[0m
[30;1m676 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m665 | [0m[35mRemember: Kubernetes prohibits using query parameters and fragments in the URLs.[0m
[30;1m666 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m667 | [0m[35mIn most cases, only one yielded config is enough if the server is going[0m
[30;1m668 | [0m[35mto serve the requests at the same endpoint.[0m
[30;1m669 | [0m[35mIn rare cases when the endpoint changes over time (e.g. for dynamic tunnels),[0m
[30;1m670 | [0m[35mthe server/tunnel should yield a new config every time the endpoint changes,[0m
[30;1m671 | [0m[35mand the webhook manager will reconfigure all managed webhooks accordingly.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m360[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m635 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m636 | [0m[35m* ``webhook`` (``str``) -- to execute only one specific handler/webhook.[0m
[30;1m637 | [0m[35m  The id usually comes from the URL, which the framework injects automatically.[0m
[30;1m638 | [0m[35m  It is highly recommended to provide at least this hint:[0m
[30;1m639 | [0m[35m  otherwise, all admission handlers are executed, with mutating and validating[0m
[30;1m640 | [0m[35m  handlers mixed, which can lead to mutating patches returned for validation[0m
[30;1m641 | [0m[35m  requests, which in turn will fail the admission on the Kubernetes side.[0m

[30;1m553 | [0m[35m    def config(settings: kopf.OperatorSettings, **_):[0m
[30;1m554 | [0m[35m        settings.admission.server = kopf.WebhookServer(cadump='selfsigned.pem')[0m

[30;1m560 | [0m[35mFor production, a properly generated certificate should be used.[0m

[30;1m541 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m542 | [0m[35mThat endpoint can be accessed directly with ``curl``:[0m
[30;1m543 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m545 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m547 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m548 | [0m[35mIt is possible to store the generated certificate itself and use as a CA:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m363[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m

[30;1m531 | [0m[35mFor this reason, Kopf runs the webhook servers/tunnels with HTTPS by default.[0m
[30;1m532 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m533 | [0m[35mIf a webhook server is configured without a server certificate,[0m
[30;1m534 | [0m[35ma self-signed certificate is generated at startup, and only HTTPS is served.[0m
[30;1m535 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m536 | [0m[35m.. code-block:: python[0m
[30;1m537 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m177 | [0m[35mFor update and deletion requests, the actual memos of the resources are used.[0m
[30;1m178 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m179 | [0m[35mFor the admission requests on resource creation, a memo is created and discarded[0m
[30;1m180 | [0m[35mimmediately. It means that the creation's memos are useless at the moment.[0m
[30;1m181 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m182 | [0m[35mThis can change in the future: the memos of resource creation attempts[0m
[30;1m183 | [0m[35mwill be preserved for a limited but short time (configurable),[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/admission.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m174 | [0m[35mKopf provides :doc:`/memos` for each resource. However, webhooks can happen[0m
[30;1m175 | [0m[35mbefore a resource is created. This affects how the memos work.[0m
[30;1m176 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m177 | [0m[35mFor update and deletion requests, the actual memos of the resources are used.[0m
[30;1m178 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m179 | [0m[35mFor the admission requests on resource creation, a memo is created and discarded[0m
[30;1m180 | [0m[35mimmediately. It means that the creation's memos are useless at the moment.[0m

[30;1m1 | [0m[35m=================[0m
[30;1m2 | [0m[35mAdmission control[0m
[30;1m3 | [0m[35m=================[0m
[30;1m4 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35mAdmission hooks are callbacks from Kubernetes to the operator before[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35mthe resources are created or modified. There are two types of hooks:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m375[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m

[30;1m667 | [0m[35mIn most cases, only one yielded config is enough if the server is going[0m
[30;1m668 | [0m[35mto serve the requests at the same endpoint.[0m
[30;1m669 | [0m[35mIn rare cases when the endpoint changes over time (e.g. for dynamic tunnels),[0m
[30;1m670 | [0m[35mthe server/tunnel should yield a new config every time the endpoint changes,[0m
[30;1m671 | [0m[35mand the webhook manager will reconfigure all managed webhooks accordingly.[0m
[30;1m672 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m673 | [0m[35mThe server/tunnel must hold control by running the server or by sleeping.[0m

[30;1m481 | [0m[35mor occasionally at runtime; the network might have issues too. In most cases,[0m

[30;1m483 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m484 | [0m[35mThe framework retries the TCP/SSL networking errors and the HTTP 5xx errors[0m

[30;1m408 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m409 | [0m[35mThe last-handled configuration is also used to detect if there were any[0m
[30;1m410 | [0m[35messential changes at all -- i.e. not just the system or status fields.[0m
[30;1m411 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m412 | [0m[35mThe last-handled configuration storage can be configured[0m
[30;1m413 | [0m[35mwith ``settings.persistence.diffbase_storage``.[0m

[30;1m404 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m405 | [0m[35mFor change-detecting handlers, Kopf keeps the last handled configuration --[0m
[30;1m406 | [0m[35mi.e. the last state that has been successfully handled. New changes are compared[0m
[30;1m407 | [0m[35magainst the last handled configuration, and a diff list is formed.[0m
[30;1m408 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m409 | [0m[35mThe last-handled configuration is also used to detect if there were any[0m
[30;1m410 | [0m[35messential changes at all -- i.e. not just the system or status fields.[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m

[30;1m30 | [0m[35m        if self.field is not None and isinstance(cause, causes.ChangingCause):[0m
[30;1m31 | [0m[35m            old = dicts.resolve(cause.old, self.field, None)[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35m            new = dicts.resolve(cause.new, self.field, None)[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35m            diff = diffs.reduce(cause.diff, self.field)[0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35m            new_cause = dataclasses.replace(cause, old=old, new=new, diff=diff)[0m
[30;1m35 | [0m[35m            return cast(execution.CauseT, new_cause)  # TODO: mypy bug?[0m
[30;1m36 | [0m[35m        else:[0m

[30;1m502 | [0m[35mauthentication, health probing, and for the indexing functions themselves:[0m
[30;1m503 | [0m[35mthe indices are available in kwargs but can be empty or partially populated[0m
[30;1m504 | [0m[35min the operator's startup and index pre-population stage. This can affect[0m
[30;1m505 | [0m[35mthe cleanup/login/probe handlers if they are invoked at that stage.[0m
[30;1m506 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m507 | [0m[35mThough, the indices are safe to be passed to threads/tasks for later processing[0m
[30;1m508 | [0m[35mif such threads/tasks are started from the before-mentioned startup handlers.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m427[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m416 | [0m[35m(the default is 60 seconds; for no delay, use ``0`` explicitly);[0m
[30;1m417 | [0m[35mthe ``retries=`` and ``timeout=`` are the limit of retries and the overall[0m
[30;1m418 | [0m[35mduration since the first failure until the resource will be marked[0m
[30;1m419 | [0m[35mas permanently excluded from indexing (unless it succeeds at some point).[0m
[30;1m420 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m421 | [0m[35mThe handler's kwargs :kwarg:`retry`, :kwarg:`started`, :kwarg:`runtime`[0m
[30;1m422 | [0m[35mreport the retrying attempts since the first indexing failure.[0m

[30;1m160 | [0m[35m    This method is used when the resource is deleted.[0m
[30;1m161 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m162 | [0m[35m    The difference is that in this method (termination with delays and patches),[0m
[30;1m163 | [0m[35m    other on-deletion handlers can be happening at the same time as the daemons[0m
[30;1m164 | [0m[35m    are being terminated (it can take time due to backoffs and timeouts).[0m
[30;1m165 | [0m[35m    In the end, the finalizer should be removed only once all deletion handlers[0m
[30;1m166 | [0m[35m    have succeeded and all daemons are terminated -- not earlier than that.[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m262 | [0m[35m        after the previous daemon is fully stopped.[0m
[30;1m263 | [0m[35m        There are never 2 instances of the same daemon running in parallel.[0m
[30;1m264 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m265 | [0m[35m        In normal cases (enough time is given to stop), this is usually done[0m
[30;1m266 | [0m[35m        by the post-pause re-listing event. In rare cases when the re-pausing[0m
[30;1m267 | [0m[35m        happens faster than the daemon is stopped (highly unlikely to happen),[0m
[30;1m268 | [0m[35m        that event can be missed because the daemon is being stopped yet,[0m

[30;1m17 | [0m[35mFor this, there is an artificial root task spawned to kill all the daemons[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35mwhen the operator exits, and all root tasks are gracefully/forcedly terminated.[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35mOtherwise, all the daemons would be considered as "hung" tasks and will be[0m

[30;1m10 | [0m[35mand allows a Kubernetes cluster to be extended with the arbitrary[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mcustom resources and custom controllers.[0m

[30;1m13 | [0m[35mOn the top level, it consists of the Kubernetes API, through which the users[0m
[30;1m14 | [0m[35mtalk to Kubernetes, internal storage of the state of the objects (etcd),[0m
[30;1m15 | [0m[35mand a collection of controllers. The command-line tooling (``kubectl``)[0m
[30;1m16 | [0m[35mcan also be considered as a part of the solution.[0m

[30;1m289 | [0m[35m                # the order in which the coros/waiters are checked once control returns to asyncio.[0m
[30;1m290 | [0m[35m                # As a work-around, we double-check the queue and exit only if it is truly empty;[0m
[30;1m291 | [0m[35m                # if not, run as normally. IMPORTANT: There MUST be NO async/await-code between[0m
[30;1m292 | [0m[35m                # "break" and "finally", so that the queue is not populated again.[0m

[30;1m141 | [0m[35m    The watcher is generally a never-ending task (unless an error happens or it is cancelled).[0m
[30;1m142 | [0m[35m    The workers, on the other hand, are limited approximately to the life-time of an object's event.[0m

[30;1m147 | [0m[35m    we can make a decision on whether it was a real cancellation, or our own.[0m

[30;1m204 | [0m[35m    with no group name (e.g. ``('pods')`` instead of ``('v1', 'pods')``).[0m
[30;1m205 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m206 | [0m[35m    To avoid scanning the whole cluster and all (even unused) API groups,[0m
[30;1m207 | [0m[35m    it is recommended to specify at least the group names for all resources,[0m
[30;1m208 | [0m[35m    especially in reusable and publicly distributed operators.[0m

[30;1m199 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m200 | [0m[35m    Some API groups are served by API extensions: e.g. ``metrics.k8s.io``.[0m
[30;1m201 | [0m[35m    If the extension's deployment/service/pods are down, such a group will[0m
[30;1m202 | [0m[35m    not be scannable (failing with "HTTP 503 Service Unavailable")[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35m    and will block scanning the whole cluster if resources are specified[0m
[30;1m204 | [0m[35m    with no group name (e.g. ``('pods')`` instead of ``('v1', 'pods')``).[0m
[30;1m205 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m316 | [0m[35m    this will not be considered as an update but as a creation.[0m
[30;1m317 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m318 | [0m[35m    From the operator's point of view, the object has suddenly appeared[0m
[30;1m319 | [0m[35m    in sight with no diff-base, which means that it is a newly created object;[0m

[30;1m296 | [0m[35mThe following wrappers are available:[0m
[30;1m297 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m298 | [0m[35m* ``kopf.not_(fn)`` -- the function must return ``False`` to pass the filters.[0m
[30;1m299 | [0m[35m* ``kopf.any_([...])`` -- at least one of the functions must return ``True``.[0m
[30;1m300 | [0m[35m* ``kopf.all_([...])`` -- all of the functions must return ``True``.[0m
[30;1m301 | [0m[35m* ``kopf.none_([...])`` -- all of the functions must return ``False``.[0m
[30;1m302 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m131 | [0m[35m    **Technically,** the update handlers are called after the change has already[0m
[30;1m132 | [0m[35m    happened on the low level -- i.e. when the field already has the new value.[0m

[30;1m137 | [0m[35m    in-between the old and new states, and therefore belong to both of them.[0m

[30;1m138 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m139 | [0m[35m    **In general,** the resource-changing handlers are an abstraction on top[0m
[30;1m140 | [0m[35m    of the low-level K8s machinery for eventual processing of such state[0m
[30;1m141 | [0m[35m    transitions, so their semantics can differ from K8s's low-level semantics.[0m
[30;1m142 | [0m[35m    In most cases, this is not visible or important to the operator developers,[0m
[30;1m143 | [0m[35m    except for such cases, where it might affect the semantics of e.g. filters.[0m

[30;1m95 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m96 | [0m[35m.. note::[0m
[30;1m97 | [0m[35m    The liveness status report is simplistic and minimalistic at the moment.[0m
[30;1m98 | [0m[35m    It only reports success if the health-reporting task runs at all.[0m
[30;1m99 | [0m[35m    It can happen so that some of the operator's tasks, threads, or streams[0m
[30;1m100 | [0m[35m    do break, freeze, or become unresponsive, while the health-reporting task[0m
[30;1m101 | [0m[35m    continues to run. The probability of such a case is low, but not zero.[0m

[30;1m76 | [0m[35mdef validate_subresources(spec, subresource, status, warnings: List[str], **_):[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35m    if subresource == 'status' and status.get('field') != spec.get('field'):[0m
[30;1m78 | [0m[35m        raise kopf.AdmissionError("status.field MUST be equal to spec.field!")[0m
[30;1m79 | [0m[35m    elif subresource is None and status.get('field') != spec.get('field'):[0m
[30;1m80 | [0m[35m        warnings.append("Also update status.field to match spec.field: "[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m693[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000700[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m

[30;1m64 | [0m[35m@kopf.on.validate('kex')[0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35mdef validate1(spec, dryrun, **_):[0m
[30;1m66 | [0m[35m    if not dryrun and spec.get('field') == 'wrong':[0m
[30;1m67 | [0m[35m        raise kopf.AdmissionError("Meh! I don't like it. Change the field.")[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/tips-and-tricks.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mBoth successful executions and permanent errors of change-detecting handlers[0m
[30;1m12 | [0m[35monly exclude these handlers from the current handling cycle, which is scoped[0m
[30;1m13 | [0m[35mto the current change-set (i.e. one diff of an object).[0m
[30;1m14 | [0m[35mOn the next change, the handlers will be invoked again, regardless of their[0m
[30;1m15 | [0m[35mprevious permanent error.[0m
[30;1m16 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m739[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/examples/05-handlers/README.md[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m3 | [0m[35mMultiple handlers can be registered for the same event.[0m
[30;1m4 | [0m[35mThey are executed in the order of registration.[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35mBesides the standard create-update-delete events, a per-field diff can be registered.[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35mIt is called only in case of the specified field changes,[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35mwith `old` & `new` set to that field's values.[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m28 | [0m[35mThese tests ensure that the thread-safe calls are used for k8s-event posting[0m
[30;1m29 | [0m[35mby artificially reproducing the described situation. The delayed no-op task[0m
[30;1m30 | [0m[35m(awakener) is used to wake up the event-loop after some time if the k8s-event[0m
[30;1m31 | [0m[35mposting is not thread-safe. Otherwise, it wakes up on ``queue.get()`` instantly.[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35mIf thread safety is not ensured, the operators get sporadic errors regarding[0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35mthread-unsafe calls, which are difficult to catch and reproduce.[0m

[30;1m404 | [0m[35m    deducted from any other timeouts, such as the daemon cancellation timeout.[0m
[30;1m405 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m406 | [0m[35m    So, keep the timeout low: 0.001, 0.01, or 0.1 are good enough; 1.0 is risky.[0m
[30;1m407 | [0m[35m    Big delays can cause slower operator reaction to the resource deletion[0m
[30;1m408 | [0m[35m    or operator exiting, but can reduce the amount of unnecessary patches.[0m
[30;1m409 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m803[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_cogs/configs/configuration.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m400 | [0m[35m    then external polling is initiated via the resource's persistence storages,[0m
[30;1m401 | [0m[35m    as for regular handlers.[0m
[30;1m402 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m403 | [0m[35m    The "instant exit" timeout is neither combined with any other timeouts, nor[0m
[30;1m404 | [0m[35m    deducted from any other timeouts, such as the daemon cancellation timeout.[0m
[30;1m405 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m95 | [0m[35m============[0m
[30;1m96 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m97 | [0m[35mIn case no handlers are explicitly declared, Kopf attempts to authenticate[0m
[30;1m98 | [0m[35mwith the existing Kubernetes libraries if they are installed.[0m
[30;1m99 | [0m[35mAt the moment: pykube-ng_ and kubernetes_.[0m
[30;1m100 | [0m[35mIn the future, more libraries can be added for authentication piggybacking.[0m
[30;1m101 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m102 | [0m[35m.. _pykube-ng: https://github.com/hjacobs/pykube[0m

[30;1m81 | [0m[35mmapped to TCP/SSL/HTTPS protocols in the API clients. It is the responsibility[0m
[30;1m82 | [0m[35mof the authentication handlers to ensure that the values are consistent[0m
[30;1m83 | [0m[35mand valid (e.g. via internal verification calls). It is in theory possible[0m
[30;1m84 | [0m[35mto mix all authentication methods at once or to have none of them at all.[0m
[30;1m85 | [0m[35mIf the credentials are inconsistent or invalid, there will be permanent[0m
[30;1m86 | [0m[35mre-authentication happening.[0m
[30;1m87 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m10 | [0m[35mwith the Kubernetes API either via the service account or raw kubeconfig data[0m

[30;1m60 | [0m[35mthey will collide with each other and the consequences are unpredictable.[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m58 | [0m[35mPlease note that there is only one replica. Keep it so. If there will be[0m
[30;1m59 | [0m[35mtwo or more operators running in the cluster for the same objects,[0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35mthey will collide with each other and the consequences are unpredictable.[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35mIn case of pod restarts, only one pod should be running at a time too:[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35muse ``.spec.strategy.type=Recreate`` (see the documentation_).[0m
[30;1m63 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m64 | [0m[35m.. _documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#recreate-de[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m140 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m141 | [0m[35mThe timer's own interval is only used if the function exits successfully.[0m
[30;1m142 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m143 | [0m[35mFor example, if the handler fails 3 times with a back-off time set to 5 seconds[0m
[30;1m144 | [0m[35mand the interval set to 10 seconds, it will take 25 seconds (``3*5+10``)[0m
[30;1m145 | [0m[35mfrom the first execution to the end of the retrying cycle:[0m
[30;1m146 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m27 | [0m[35m=========[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m29 | [0m[35mUsually (by default), the timers are invoked with the specified interval[0m
[30;1m30 | [0m[35mbetween each call. The time taken by the handler itself is not taken into[0m
[30;1m31 | [0m[35maccount. It is possible to define timers with a sharp schedule: i.e. invoked[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35mevery number of seconds sharp, no matter how long it takes to execute it:[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m300 | [0m[35mAlways access the fields through the provided kwargs, and do not store[0m
[30;1m301 | [0m[35mthem in local variables. Internally, Kopf substitutes the whole object's[0m
[30;1m302 | [0m[35mbody on every external change. Storing the field values to the variables[0m
[30;1m303 | [0m[35mwill remember their value as it was at that moment in time,[0m

[30;1m161 | [0m[35mEither design the daemons to exit as fast as possible, or configure[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m113 | [0m[35m  * Builtin K8s resources (pods, namespaces, etc).[0m
[30;1m114 | [0m[35m  * Multiple resource types in one operator.[0m
[30;1m115 | [0m[35m  * Both cluster and namespaced operators.[0m
[30;1m116 | [0m[35m* All the ways of handling that a developer can wish for:[0m
[30;1m117 | [0m[35m  * Low-level handlers for events received from K8s APIs "as is" (an equivalent of _informers_).[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m  * High-level handlers for detected causes of changes (creation, updates with diffs, deletion).[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m  * Handling of selected fields only instead of the whole objects (if needed).[0m

[30;1m18 | [0m[35mThis raises the entry barrier to the operator development field.[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m16 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35mIn a perfect world of Kopf, Kubernetes operators are a commodity,[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35mused to build the domain logic on top of Kubernetes fast and with ease,[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35mrequiring little or no skills in infrastructure management.[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35mFor this, Kopf hides the low-level infrastructure details from the user[0m

[30;1m202 | [0m[35mIn this example, if the operator starts and notices an object that is marked[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35mfor deletion, the deletion handler will be called, but the resuming handler[0m
[30;1m204 | [0m[35mis not called at all, despite the object was noticed to exist out there.[0m

[30;1m207 | [0m[35mIf the resume handlers are still desired during the deletion handling, they[0m

[30;1m389 | [0m[35m# Some predefined API endpoints that we use in the framework itself (not exposed to the operators).[0m
[30;1m390 | [0m[35m# Note: the CRDs are versionless: we do not look into its ``spec`` stanza, we only watch for[0m
[30;1m391 | [0m[35m# the fact of changes, so the schema does not matter, any cluster-preferred API version would work.[0m
[30;1m392 | [0m[35m# Note: the peering resources are usually either zalando.org/v1 or kopf.dev/v1; if both co-exist,[0m
[30;1m393 | [0m[35m# then both will be served (for keepalives and pausing). It is done for domain name transitioning.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1021[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_cogs/structs/diffs.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m157 | [0m[35m    Therefore, an addition/removal of a list item is considered[0m
[30;1m158 | [0m[35m    as a change of the whole value.[0m
[30;1m159 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m160 | [0m[35m    If the deep diff for lists/sets is needed, see the libraries:[0m
[30;1m161 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m162 | [0m[35m    * https://dictdiffer.readthedocs.io/en/latest/[0m
[30;1m163 | [0m[35m    * https://github.com/seperman/deepdiff[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1022[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_cogs/structs/diffs.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m146 | [0m[35m        scope: DiffScope = DiffScope.FULL,[0m
[30;1m147 | [0m[35m) -> Iterator[DiffItem]:[0m
[30;1m148 | [0m[35m    """[0m
[30;1m149 | [0m[35m    Calculate the diff between two dicts.[0m
[30;1m150 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m151 | [0m[35m    Yields the tuple of form ``(op, path, old, new)``,[0m
[30;1m152 | [0m[35m    where ``op`` is either ``"add"``/``"change"``/``"remove"``,[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1023[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_cogs/structs/diffs.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m        # The diff-field is shorter than the path: get "spec.struct" when "spec={...}" is added.[0m
[30;1m126 | [0m[35m        # Generate a new diff, with new ops, for the resolved sub-field.[0m
[30;1m127 | [0m[35m        elif tuple(field) == tuple(path[:len(field)]):[0m
[30;1m128 | [0m[35m            tail = path[len(field):][0m
[30;1m129 | [0m[35m            old_tail = dicts.resolve(old, tail, default=None)[0m
[30;1m130 | [0m[35m            new_tail = dicts.resolve(new, tail, default=None)[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35m            yield from diff_iter(old_tail, new_tail)[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1024[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m

[30;1m17 | [0m[35m    to the right one for all fields.[0m

[30;1m19 | [0m[35m    In the left-scoped diff, only the left object (diff source) is considered[0m

[30;1m128 | [0m[35mMultiple operators[0m
[30;1m129 | [0m[35m==================[0m
[30;1m130 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35mKopf can handle multiple resources at a time, so only one instance should be[0m
[30;1m132 | [0m[35msufficient for most cases. However, it can be needed to run multiple isolated[0m
[30;1m133 | [0m[35moperators in the same process.[0m
[30;1m134 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m102 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m103 | [0m[35m    Silencing errors goes against The Zen of Python, but we need this for K8s:[0m
[30;1m104 | [0m[35m    if the resources are corrupted externally (e.g. by editing manually),[0m
[30;1m105 | [0m[35m    we ignore that corrupted data as if there is no data at all,[0m
[30;1m106 | [0m[35m    and continue running instead of unrecoverably failing the processing.[0m
[30;1m107 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m108 | [0m[35m    Examples of data that can be corrupted:[0m

[30;1m15 | [0m[35mSuch volumes can be used as a workspace for large data-crunching jobs.[0m
[30;1m16 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35mThere is `Local Ephemeral Storage`__, which allocates some space on a node's[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35mroot partition shared with the docker images and other containers,[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35mbut it is often limited in size depending on the node/cluster config:[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m__ https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-compute-resources-container/#local-ephem[0m

[30;1m258 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m259 | [0m[35m    It is a simplified equivalent of aiojobs, but compatible with Python 3.10.[0m
[30;1m260 | [0m[35m    Python 3.10 removed the explicit event loops (deprecated since Python 3.7),[0m
[30;1m261 | [0m[35m    which broke aiojobs. At the same time, aiojobs looks unmaintained[0m
[30;1m262 | [0m[35m    and contains no essential changes since July 2019 (i.e. for 2+ years).[0m
[30;1m263 | [0m[35m    Hence the necessity to replicate the functionality.[0m
[30;1m264 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1096[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m39 | [0m[35m    As such, we generally need to create a dummy task and cancel it immediately.[0m

[30;1m42 | [0m[35m    in the multiplexer: when the watcher exits, it cancels all pending workers.[0m

[30;1m388 | [0m[35m        # But since a callback cannot be async, "awaiting" is done in a background utility task.[0m
[30;1m389 | [0m[35m        self._running_tasks.discard(task)[0m

[30;1m46 | [0m[35m    def create_job(status, **_):[0m
[30;1m47 | [0m[35m        if not status.get('create_pvc', {}):[0m
[30;1m48 | [0m[35m            raise kopf.TemporaryError("PVC is not created yet.", delay=10)[0m
[30;1m49 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m50 | [0m[35m        pvc_name = status['create_pvc']['name'][0m

[30;1m51 | [0m[35mare ignored and not handled. They will be handled when the operator starts:[0m
[30;1m52 | [0m[35mevery time a Kopf-based operator starts, it lists all objects of the[0m
[30;1m53 | [0m[35mresource kind, and checks for their state; if the state has changed since[0m
[30;1m54 | [0m[35mthe object was last handled (no matter how long time ago),[0m
[30;1m55 | [0m[35ma new handling cycle starts.[0m
[30;1m56 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m57 | [0m[35mOnly the last state is taken into account. All the intermediate changes[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m42 | [0m[35mTimers are triggered on a regular schedule, regardless of whether anything[0m
[30;1m43 | [0m[35mchanges or does not change in the resource itself. This can be used to[0m
[30;1m44 | [0m[35mverify both the resource's body, and the state of other related resources[0m
[30;1m45 | [0m[35mthrough API calls, and update the original resource's status/content.[0m
[30;1m46 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m47 | [0m[35m.. seealso::[0m
[30;1m48 | [0m[35m    :doc:`timers`[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1118[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/reconciliation.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mKopf is not an operator, it is a framework to make operators.[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mTherefore, it knows nothing about the *desired state* or *actual state*[0m
[30;1m12 | [0m[35m(or any *state* at all).[0m
[30;1m13 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m14 | [0m[35mKopf-based operators must implement the checks and reactions to the changes,[0m
[30;1m15 | [0m[35mso that both states are synchronised according to the operator's concepts.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1119[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/reconciliation.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35mNormally, Kopf triggers the on-creation/on-update/on-deletion handlers[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mevery time anything changes on the object, as reported by Kubernetes API.[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35mIt provides both the current state of the object and a diff list[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35mwith the last handled state.[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35mThe event-driven approach is the best, as it saves system resources (RAM & CPU),[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1120[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/reconciliation.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m======================[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35mNormally, Kopf triggers the on-creation/on-update/on-deletion handlers[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mevery time anything changes on the object, as reported by Kubernetes API.[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35mIt provides both the current state of the object and a diff list[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35mwith the last handled state.[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m73 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m74 | [0m[35m    With :func:`any`, the set is "on" when at least one child toggle is "on"[0m
[30;1m75 | [0m[35m    (and it has at least one child), and it is "off" when all children toggles[0m

[30;1m115 | [0m[35m    Constructed in event handling of each individual object.[0m
[30;1m116 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m117 | [0m[35m    The internal structure is made the same as an object reference in K8s API,[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m    but can change over time to anything needed for our internal purposes.[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m    However, as little information should be carried as possible,[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m    and the information should be protected against the object modification[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m    (e.g. in case of background posting via the queue; see `K8sPoster`).[0m

[30;1m117 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m.. code-block:: bash[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m    kubectl get pv[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m122 | [0m[35m.. code-block:: none[0m

[30;1m150 | [0m[35m    assert k8s_mocked.sleep.call_count == 0[0m

[30;1m363 | [0m[35m    or on operator restart for the pre-existing (already handled) resources.[0m
[30;1m364 | [0m[35m    When a resource is created during the operator downtime, it is[0m
[30;1m365 | [0m[35m    both creation and resuming at the same time: the object is new (not yet[0m
[30;1m366 | [0m[35m    handled) **AND** it is detected as per-existing before operator start.[0m
[30;1m367 | [0m[35m    But `fn()` should be called only once for this cause.[0m
[30;1m368 | [0m[35m    """[0m

[30;1m198 | [0m[35mStealth keep-alive[0m
[30;1m199 | [0m[35m==================[0m
[30;1m200 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m201 | [0m[35mEvery few seconds (60 by default), the operator will send a keep-alive update[0m
[30;1m202 | [0m[35mto the chosen peering, showing that it is still functioning. Other operators[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35mwill notice that and make decisions on their pausing or resuming.[0m
[30;1m204 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m205 | [0m[35mThe operator also logs a keep-alive activity to its logs. This can be[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1389[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m188 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m190 | [0m[35m(if you use another shell, see its man page for an equivalent).[0m
[30;1m191 | [0m[35mIt returns a random integer in the range 0..32767.[0m
[30;1m192 | [0m[35mWith high probability, 2-3 pods will get their unique priorities.[0m
[30;1m193 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m160 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m161 | [0m[35mUsually, one and only one operator instance should be deployed for the resource.[0m
[30;1m162 | [0m[35mIf that operator's pod dies, the handling of the resource of this type[0m
[30;1m163 | [0m[35mwill stop until the operator's pod is restarted (and if restarted at all).[0m
[30;1m164 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m165 | [0m[35mTo start multiple operator pods, they must be distinctly prioritised.[0m
[30;1m166 | [0m[35mIn that case, only one operator will be active --- the one with the highest[0m

[30;1m82 | [0m[35m    At runtime, both API groups are supported. However, these resources[0m
[30;1m83 | [0m[35m    of different API groups are mutually exclusive and cannot co-exist[0m
[30;1m84 | [0m[35m    in the same cluster since they use the same names. Whenever possible,[0m

[30;1m7 | [0m[35m# so we mock all external(!) libraries to return the results as we expect them.[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35m# This reduces the quality of the tests, but makes them simple.[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m@pytest.fixture(autouse=True)[0m

[30;1m11 | [0m[35m    mocker.patch('ssl.get_server_certificate', return_value='')[0m

[30;1m17 | [0m[35mIf the object has to be deleted without the operator starting again,[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35myou can remove the finalizers manually:[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m.. code-block:: bash[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m    kubectl patch kopfexample kopf-example-1 -p '{"metadata": {"finalizers": []}}' --type merge[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mThe object will be removed by Kubernetes immediately.[0m

[30;1m7 | [0m[35m``kubectl`` freezes on object deletion[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35m======================================[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mThis can happen if the operator is down at the moment of deletion.[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m12 | [0m[35mThe operator puts the finalizers on the objects as soon as it notices[0m
[30;1m13 | [0m[35mthem for the first time. When the objects are *requested for deletion*,[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1438[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/docs/troubleshooting.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35mIf the object has to be deleted without the operator starting again,[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35myou can remove the finalizers manually:[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m.. code-block:: bash[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m    kubectl patch kopfexample kopf-example-1 -p '{"metadata": {"finalizers": []}}' --type merge[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mThe object will be removed by Kubernetes immediately.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1439[0m[34m of [0m[33m1484[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/kopf-1.37.5/kopf/_kits/runner.py[0m
